userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials from Washington & Lee University's Special Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study, pursuant to U.S. Copyright law. The user assumes full responsibility for any use of the materials, including but not limited to, infringement of copyright and publication rights of reproduced materials. Any materials used should be fully credited with the source.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Both original notebooks are in very poor condition and should only be used at the discretion of the Head of Special Collections and Archives. A user copy for each volume is housed with the original.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation: [Identification of item], Joseph Glass lecture notebooks, WLU Coll. 0127, Special Collections and Archives, James G. Leyburn Library, Washington and Lee University, Lexington, VA
In some cases the citation format may vary. Please contact Special Collections' staff to verify the appropriate format.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains two notebooks of student Joseph Glass' class notes taken on William Graham's lectures on human nature.
